Name: Highlander
Current Status: Lying in Heswall Boat yard last 10 years, cuddy removed and decking changed to resemble a half rater

Name: Hibernia
Current Status: Last heard located at Fiddlers Ferry SC

Name: Hieros
Current Status: Understood to be in a garden in Chester

Name: High & Dry
Current Status: Went down in the Persian gulf after 130 degree temperatures in 1981

Name: Hijack
Current Status: Set on fire and destroyed in Nevin,in 1995 after a dispute with local fishermen

Name: Hibiscus
Current Status: Sunk when it disappeared from its mooring at Tranmere in 1984

Name: Hideaway
Current Status: Originally built out of class, subsequently altered and accepted by the Association in 1978. Five similar boats thought to have been built but not classed as Hilbres. Last Heard in West Lancs SC in 1996

Name: Hispaniola
Current Status: Last heard of heard in Irvine, Scotland

Name: Hiatus
Current Status: Last heard of in Barrow in Furness

Name: Hiraethog
Current Status: WKSC-Hilbre Association Boat....Undergoing a rebuild by the Association

Name: Hilo
Current Status: Wrecked when escaped moorings at West Kirby SC

Name: Hinayana
Current Status: Poorly repaired in the past and beyond economic repair and subsequently set on fire on bonfire night

Name: Hinden
Current Status: Destroyed when put in a skip in Liverpool by over keen repairers who cut three feet off the stern in 1994

Name: Hirundo
Current Status: Broken up and burnt with parts re-used

Name: Highcrest
Current Status: Wrecked when came off its moorings at West Kirby SC

Name: Hindu Honey
Current Status: Destroyed/sank in North Wales with parts made available to the Hilbre Association

Name: Hibrena
Current Status: Cut up and burnt in 2002 and parts salvaged for use by the Association

Name: Hifactum
Current Status: Lying in a garden in the Irby, Wirral

Name: Hi C
Current Status: Hilbre Association boat requiring extensive work

Name: Hi Di Hi
Current Status: Damaged beyond repair and burnt on bonfire night 2011 at WKSC

Name: Hikari
Current Status: Converted to fishing boat, although understood now to be destroyed and burnt

Name: Hinon
Current Status: Lying in a garden in Buckley, in a poor condition

Name: Hiriver
Current Status: Sunk in the river Mersey, when swamped by the Isle of Man Ferry in 1970
